column4: anybody ever tried to get a creative zen nano plus working with ubuntu?
nope, but I think it just works as a regular USB Mass Storage Device
i thought so too
but it just locks everything up
ooh... maybe dmesg output or /var/log/messages* can assist you in tracing down what the problem is ?
you get the message of a new usb devices in /var/log/messages but if you try to cat /proc/bus/usb/devices
it locks until you remove the zen
rephrase that sentence please. it doesn't make sence
ok I get it now after your sec comment
:) sorry habit of typing in a less crowded channel
no problem!
I suggest googling for it.. something like 'using zen on linux' for example.. I think that, if there is a fix, google knows it

in windows, it does indeed come up as a mass storage thing, but in linux it come up and nothing, i have tried gnomad2 and that just hangs, I have tried a standard pen drive to make sure Im not going mad and that works
looks like im hosed then, have been googling for about an hour :(
right im off to the pub sod this ;)
ahh crap.. I'm suspecting that it is something in the kernel that is not responding to some querry made by the zen
maybe you can try upgrading your kernel .. which kernel are you using ?
well i have a week off work, how hard can it been to write a device driver? (2.6.12-8-386 ooh not 12-9 will have to check that)!
cheers for you help, i really am off now
goodbye!
(perhaps try 686 kernel :P)
